messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: pets/dogs--less poop?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/03 7:39:53 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Their mother is 100% yellow lab.  She comes from award winning stock. She is a wonderful,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/03 7:39:53 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
mummy124@... writes:

> Okay Teresa, don't get any ideas but what kind of puppies????
>
>
> Mary B
>

Their mother is 100% yellow lab. She comes from "award winning" stock. She
is a wonderful, smart, loving dog. Thier father is a deadbeat dad who lives
somewhere within "heat radius".. LOL. All we know for sure is that he is
black, and a large breed dog. All 9 puppies are black with some white on thier
chests. Some have white feet. There are 4 females, 5 males.. We are keeping
one male. ( his name is Pinky, he has a pink spot on his nose) I have pix Joy
and the puppies. We would like to place them ASAP after thier 8 week
birthday.

Teresa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: pets/dogs--less poop?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/03 4:34:11 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Yeah, the Petsmart lady said Nutro was good too.   I bought 20lbs of puppy food last
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/03 4:34:11 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
kbcdlovejo@... writes:

> My GSD gets one cup of Nutro
>

Yeah, the Petsmart lady said Nutro was good too. I bought 20lbs of puppy
food last Thursday, and we only have enough left for tomorrow!!.. I was
SHOCKED. .. we feed the puppies twice a day, they might nurse a little too ( if Joy
will allow it).. I didn't think about how much food 9 puppies need!. Now
that I have calculated it, those 9 puppies are probably equal to 3 grown
dogs.. maybe even 4.. So, it makes sense they ate 20lbs of food in 6 days.. OH,
and I think Joy ate some of it too.. The puppies are sooo cute and just
growing my leaps and bounds. It's going to be hard to see them go.. Well, not hard
on our pocketbook.. lol (Anybody want a puppy??.. HEY, I'll drive up to an
hour to deliver one )

Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: pets/dogs--less poop?
messages.msgSnippet: Try the BARF diet  http://www.barfdiet.com/ Our poodle s on it and doing so well and the poop is not a problem at all. My thots Tim T P.S.  Nancy knows more
messages.messageBody:
Try the BARF diet http://www.barfdiet.com/

Our poodle's on it and doing so well and the poop is not a problem at all.

My thots
Tim T

P.S. Nancy knows more about dogs and d-food than I!

messages.messageBody:

writes:

> Oh, please tell me about the foods that produce less poop! lol
>

>

The premium dog foods we discussed earlier. Eukenuba is good, generally

Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: pets/dogs--less poop?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/2003 2:17:08 PM Eastern Daylight Time, sheran@ptd.net ... The EXPENSIVE ones, Sheila!!! Eukanuba, NutroMax, Nature s Recipe, etc. They
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/2003 2:17:08 PM Eastern Daylight Time, sheran@...
writes:


> > As for pooping there are foods that produce less poop.
>
> Oh, please tell me about the foods that produce less poop! lol
>
> Sheila
>

The EXPENSIVE ones, Sheila!!!

Eukanuba, NutroMax, Nature's Recipe, etc. They have more digestible stuff,
not just fillers. You can feed less of it too. My GSD gets one cup of Nutro
twice a day; my beagle, 1/2 cup twice a day. They're in great weight and fit. Less
poop to scoop too.

~Kelly



~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: pets/dogs--less poop?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/2003 2:17:13 PM Eastern Standard Time, sheran@ptd.net ... Oh, please tell me ... Sheila  The foods that are better for them
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/2003 2:17:13 PM Eastern Standard Time, sheran@...
writes:
> > As for pooping there are foods that produce less poop.

Oh, please tell me
> about the foods that produce less poop! lol

Sheila >>>>>>>
The foods that are better for them produce less poop cuz you feed less of it.
Meat based foods require less amounts to be fed so less kaka. They are also
firmer so no runny poops also.

Laura D
